DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate analgesic efficacy V120083 twice daily compare placebo subject moderate severe chronic pain due OA knee .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Evaluate Analgesic Efficacy Safety V120083 Subjects With Osteoarthritis ( OA ) Knee
DOC.criteria: Key Inclusion Criteria Include : 1 . Males females ≥ 40 ≤ 80 year age moderate severe chronic OA pain knee ( lasting several hour daily ) predominant pain condition least 6 month prior screen 2 . Diagnostic criterion primary pain condition ( American College Rheumatology [ ACR ] clinical radiographic criterion ) : At least 1 follow addition knee pain : age > 50 , morning stiffness < 30 minute , crepitus active motion , KellgrenLawrence ( KL ) grade 2 3 radiographic evidence screen visit determine local radiologist rheumatologist . If radiograph available , one must take diagnostic criterion must confirm randomization . 3 . Subjects whose OA pain index knee adequately treat prior screen visit : Subjects must selfreported average pain intensity rating moderate severe verbal rating scale ( ie , none , mild , moderate , severe ) 7 day prior screen visit 4 . The subject must `` average pain last 24 hour '' score ≥ 4 ≤ 9 11point numerical rating scale ( NRS ) index knee ≥ 3 consecutive day pain assessment period come randomization within 96 hour late qualify pain score entry 5 . Subjects willing able stop take any/all analgesic medication , include overthecounter pain medication , opioids , marijuana , topical analgesic OA pain duration study , exception studyspecific rescue medication . Key Exclusion Criteria Include : 1 . Subjects radiographic evidence OA KL grade 0,1 4 2 . Subjects chronic pain condition OA knee predominant pain condition , include gout , pseudogout , psoriatic arthritis , active Lyme disease , rheumatoid arthritis inflammatory arthritis , fibromyalgia , neuropathic pain condition , bursitis , acute injury sign active infection target pain area 3 . Subjects schedule surgical intervention disease site major surgery study conduct period 4 . Subjects history prior joint replacement index knee 5 . Subjects arthroscopy either knee hip within 6 month enter study , open surgery either knee hip within 12 month enter study 6 . Subjects history significant trauma knee , hip shoulder within previous year 7 . Subjects significant pain , knee pain , include significant hip , back pain , may confound analgesic efficacy assessment study .
